headline.main: Warren Ties Brown to G.O.P.'s Agenda on Women's Issues

docs.abstract: Elizabeth Warren sought to link comments made by Representative Todd Akin to the Republican Party's broader agenda on women's issues, and thus, to her opponent in the Massachusetts Senate race, Senator Scott P. Brown.
docs.snippet: Elizabeth Warren sought to link comments made by Representative Todd Akin to the Republican Party's broader agenda on women's issues, and thus, to her opponent in the Massachusetts Senate race, Senator Scott P. Brown.

headline.main: G.O.P. Approves Strict Anti-abortion Language in Party Platform

docs.abstract: The Republican platform committee approved language Tuesday calling for a Constitutional amendment outlawing abortion with no explicit exceptions for cases of rape or incest.
docs.snippet: The Republican platform committee approved language Tuesday calling for a Constitutional amendment outlawing abortion with no explicit exceptions for cases of rape or incest.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Akin's Evolving Media Strategy, and Student Autonomy

docs.abstract: Also, the outcry over the jailing of the feminist punk band Pussy Riot hasn't stopped Russian prosecutors from pressing ahead in the case, and a Japanese journalist is killed covering the fighting in Syria.
docs.snippet: Also, the outcry over the jailing of the feminist punk band Pussy Riot hasn't stopped Russian prosecutors from pressing ahead in the case, and a Japanese journalist is killed covering the fighting in Syria.

headline.main: Focus of Presidential Campaign Shifts Away From Economy

docs.abstract: A campaign that Republicans wanted to be focused relentlessly on President Obama's job-creation record seems, at the moment, to be about almost everything else.
docs.snippet: A campaign that Republicans wanted to be focused relentlessly on President Obama's job-creation record seems, at the moment, to be about almost everything else.

docs.lead_paragraph: The views articulated by Representative Todd Akin are far from new in anti-abortion circles, but leading experts on reproductive health said there is no solid data to support his claims.

headline.seo: Health Experts Dismiss Assertions on Rape
headline.main: Health Experts Dismiss Assertions on Rape
headline.print_headline: Health Experts Dismiss Assertions on Rape

docs.abstract: Representative Todd Akin's assertion that women who are victims of 'legitimate rape' rarely get pregnant provoked outrage across the political spectrum, but the views he articulated are far from new in anti-abortion circles; leading experts on reproductive health say there is no solid data to support his claims.
docs.snippet: The views articulated by Representative Todd Akin are far from new in anti-abortion circles, but leading experts on reproductive health said there is no solid data to support his claims.

docs.lead_paragraph: After Representative Todd Akin, Republican of Missouri, commented to a St. Louis television station on pregnancy as a result of rape, this was the sequence of events.

headline.seo: Rep. Todd Akin: ‘Legitimate Rape’ Statement and Reaction
headline.main: Rep. Todd Akin: The Statement and the Reaction

docs.abstract: Timeline depicts sequence of events after Republican Representative Todd Akin of Missouri made controversial comments about rape and abortion in a television interview.
docs.snippet: After Representative Todd Akin, Republican of Missouri, commented to a St. Louis television station on pregnancy as a result of rape, this was the sequence of events.

docs.lead_paragraph: The comment about rape made by Representative Todd Akin of Missouri shows that he and fellow primary winners are moving ever rightward with the Republican Party.

headline.seo: New Frontiers of Extremism From the G.O.P.

docs.abstract: Editorial contends that Republicans want Rep Todd Akin to drop out of the United States Senate race in Missouri not because they find his comment about rape inexcusable, but because they are afraid he will lose; warns that anyone who replaces Akin will hold similarly extreme views about abortion and other issues, given party's embrace of the far right.
docs.snippet: The comment about rape made by Representative Todd Akin of Missouri shows that he and fellow primary winners are moving ever rightward with the Republican Party.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans unleashed a furious campaign to drive Representative Todd Akin out of the Senate race in Missouri, but he said that he would not drop out.

headline.seo: Republicans Press Todd Akin to Quit Race
headline.main: G.O.P. Trying to Oust Akin From Race for Rape Remarks
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Pressures A Senate Hopeful To Quit His Race

docs.abstract: Republicans unleash a furious campaign to drive Representative Todd Akin out of the Senate race in Missouri amid an uproar over provocative comments he made on rape and abortion; strong response shows the sensitivity that social issues still hold for Republicans as they seek to narrow their deficit with women ahead of the November elections.
docs.snippet: Republicans unleashed a furious campaign to drive Representative Todd Akin out of the Senate race in Missouri, but he said that he would not drop out.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman reported from Washington, and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo. Katharine Q. Seelye contributed reporting from Boston.
byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JOHN ELIGON

headline.main: Politico Reporter Removed From Akin Coverage After Tweets

docs.abstract: Dave Catanese tweeted that there should be more discussion about Representative Todd Akin's comments about abortion and what he called "legitimate" rape.
docs.snippet: Dave Catanese tweeted that there should be more discussion about Representative Todd Akin's comments about abortion and what he called "legitimate" rape.

headline.main: Myth About Rape and Pregnancy Is Not New

docs.abstract: Despite the facts, the ancient idea that women have some natural defense against being impregnated by rapists has been endorsed several times in recent years by elected officials who oppose abortion.
docs.snippet: Despite the facts, the ancient idea that women have some natural defense against being impregnated by rapists has been endorsed several times in recent years by elected officials who oppose abortion.
